isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION 12: HIGH PRESSURE LUBE OIL SYSTEM - SUPPLY MANIFOLD REMOVAL - REMOVING THE ICP SENSOR

svcprocinfo.para: Use one of the following procedures when removing the Injection Control Pressure Sensor.

svcsubproc.title: Engines Equipped With Old Three-Way Fitting

step1.para:
Disconnect wiring harness, if not already done, and remove ICP sensor, together with O-Ring, from the three-way fitting of the supply manifold ( Figure 12.12
).

note.para: Be sure to clean any and all old Loctite(r) found on the threads of the sensor prior to installation.

figure.caption: Figure 12.11 Removing Oil Supply Hose From Engines Equipped With Engine Mounted ECM Unit
Figure 12.12 Removing ICP Sensor From Old Three-Way Fitting

svcsubproc.title: Engines Equipped With New Three-Way Fitting

step1.para:
Disconnect the wiring harness, if not already done, and remove ICP sensor, together with O-Ring, from the three-way fitting of the supply manifold ( Figure 12.13
).

note.para: Be sure to clean any and all old Loctite(r) found on the threads of the sensor prior to installation.

svcsubproc.title: Engines Equipped With Engine Mounted ECM Unit

step1.para:
Disconnect the wiring harness, if not already done and remove ICP sensor, together with O-Ring, from the supply manifold ( Figure 12.14
).

note.para: Be sure to clean any and all old Loctite(r) found on the threads of the sensor prior to installation.

step1.para:
Remove the banjo fitting at the fuel return valve, located at the rear of the supply manifold ( Figure 12.15
).

figure.caption: Figure 12.13 Removing ICP Sensor From New Three-Way Fitting
Figure 12.14 Removing ICP Sensor From Supply Manifold
Figure 12.15 Remove Banjo Fitting From Fuel Return Valve

step1.para:
Remove the fuel return valve from the supply manifold ( Figure 12.16
).
If not already done, remove the supply manifold end plug. Refer to "Removing and Installing Supply Manifold End Plug", in this section.

note.para: when the supply manifold is removed, do not place manifold face down on any surface. the manifold face could be scratched, thus preventing a good mating surface seal. always place supply manifold face up.

step1.para: Remove twelve (12) mounting bolts securing the supply manifold to the cylinder head. Remove supply manifold and gasket.

step2.para:
Figure 12.17
shows the supply manifold on an engine equipped with the old three-way fitting.

figure.caption: Figure 12.17 Removing Supply Manifold On Engines Equipped With Old Three-Way Fitting

step2.para:
Figure 12.18
shows the supply manifold on an engine equipped with the new three-way fitting.

figure.caption: Figure 12.18 Removing Supply Manifold On Engines Equipped With New Three-Way Fitting

step2.para:
Figure 12.19
shows the supply manifold on an engines equipped with the engine mounted ECM unit.

figure.caption: Figure 12.19 Removing Supply Manifold On Engines Equipped With Engine Mounted ECM Unit
